tool.name: DNA Barcode Structural Validator
tool.command:
#set $input_with_ext = None #if $input_data.is_of_type('fasta') #set $input_with_ext = "input.fasta" #else #set $input_with_ext = "input.tsv" #end if
## Create the input file with correct extension ln -sf '$input_data' '$input_with_ext' &&
#if $taxonomy_source.source_type == "nsr" mkdir -p ./nsr_data && curl -L -s "http://api.biodiversitydata.nl/v2/taxon/dwca/getDataSet/nsr" > ./nsr_data/nsr.zip &&
python -m barcode_validator --input_file '$input_with_ext' --mode structural --marker '$advanced.marker' --exp_taxonomy_type nsr --exp_taxonomy ./nsr_data/nsr.zip --output_format tsv --log_level '$advanced.log_level' #if $filter_invalid == 'yes' --triage #end if > '$output_tsv' #else python -m barcode_validator --input_file '$input_with_ext' --mode structural --marker '$advanced.marker' --exp_taxonomy_type bold --exp_taxonomy '$taxonomy_source.bold_taxonomy' --output_format tsv --log_level '$advanced.log_level' #if $filter_invalid == 'yes' --triage #end if > '$output_tsv' #end if

param.name: input_data
param.label: Input DNA sequences
param.help: FASTA file or TSV data with DNA sequences to validate

param.name: bold_taxonomy
param.label: BOLD Taxonomy file
param.help: Excel spreadsheet from BOLD containing the taxonomy

param.name: filter_invalid
param.label: Filter invalid sequences
param.help: If enabled, only valid sequences will be included in the output

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool validates DNA barcode sequences structurally to ensure they meet quality criteria for submission to international barcode repositories like BOLD. It is tailored to two specific use cases:
1. **BOLD Submission**: Validates sequences before submission to BOLD, ensuring they meet the required standards. In this case, the assumption is that the associated specimens/samples are already registered in BOLD with an acceptable taxonomic lineage attached to them. For these registered specimens/samples, a spreadsheet can be exported from BOLD, which contains the taxonomic information. The tool will use this spreadsheet to validate the sequences. 2. **NSR Validation**: Validates sequences assumed to be annotated with taxonomic identification anchored on the Dutch Species Registry (NSR). In this case, the input is tabular data with some hints about the taxonomic identification, which is expanded into lineages using the NSR, which is downloaded on the fly.
Structural validation checks:
* Minimum sequence length (typically 500 bp for COI-5P) * Number of ambiguous bases (limited to 6 for COI-5P) * Presence of stop codons in protein-coding regions (typically none allowed)
**Input**
The tool accepts:
* DNA sequences in FASTA format. If FASTA is provided, the tool assumes that the record starts with a BOLD process ID (i.e. the first word or the text string up to the first '_' character). This process ID is then looked up in the provided BOLD spreadsheet to find the corresponding taxon and upper lineage. * Tabular data with sequence information. If such data is provided, the tool will assume that the input data consists of records from the core sequence cloud, and hence are anchored on the Dutch Species Registry (NSR).
**Taxonomy Source**
For proper validation, the tool needs a taxonomy source:
* **NSR (Dutch Species Registry)**: Automatically downloaded for validation * **BOLD Taxonomy**: You need to provide an Excel spreadsheet from BOLD with the taxonomy
**Output**
The tool produces a tabular file with validation results including:
* Sequence ID * Sequence length * Number of ambiguous bases * Detected stop codons * Various quality metrics
When "Filter invalid sequences" is enabled, only sequences that pass all validation criteria will be included in the output.
**Note**
Currently only the COI-5P marker is supported. Additional markers will be added in future versions.
